Articles.Content:
A spinning station core.

How to use:

Get it to orbit.

press 1.

timewarp on x2.

timewarp to x1.

turn SAS on.

 

Pics:

 

 

IMPORTANT:

1 Q. What can I change?

1 A. You can add/remove the command pod as long as you keep the main structure untouched, you add stabilizers and connect the two modules with struts.

2 Q. What I can't change?

2 A. You must and not change:

        The rotor type.

        The rotor location.

        The middle section (there is a stabilizer).

3 Q. Why it is so slow?

3 A. The slow speed is for stability, to increase speed follow the next instructions:

        Turn the rotors on.

        Timewarp on X2.

        Wait for flying rotor/s.

        Timewarp on X1.

         Turn on SAS.

4 Q. Why it's breaking?

4 A. Don't forget that it is still a physics entity, so you might timewarped to fast and/or overstressed it with side mass.

5 Q. Can it contain snacks?

5 A. Possibly.

6 Q. It looks ugly, can i put some sort of construction around the rotors?

6 A. Only as long as the constructions don't interact with the rotors.

7 Q. Can I change the amount of the BZ-52 radial mounts on the core?

7 A. Yes, as long as you put them on the stabilizer.

8 Q. Can i change the size of the stabilizer from 1.25 m to 2.5m or 0.6 m?

8 A. NO! NO NO NO! It's a part of the spinning squad, changing it mean changing the size of the rotors (for stability)! 

9 Q. How do i lift it to space?

9 A. Build a very heavy launcher (if single launch station) or if multiple launch station, then a heavy launcher, or ALT+F12.

10 Q. How much power it has?

10 A. It was tested only on a small octagon ring, so lifting power is a question of time.

11 Q. How it works?

11 A. A stabilizer with 0 power in the middle is a holder for radial mounts, two rotors (direction matters) are used to power the station, then another 2 rotors work as friction controls to keep the spinning part from the whole spinning content, two command modules with stabilizers are used as connection between station and spinning part.

 

(warranty runs out if exposed to spinning.)

 To get support for craft, send video + pics and describe problem. To report possible improvement ideas, pm me.

NOTE: IF USED IN A CRAFT/VIDEO/IMAGE, WOULD BE NICE TO LEAVE A LINK TO THIS THREAD.

(Craft file: https://kerbalx.com/Jeronimo/Spinning-station-core )

Edited July 3, 2019 by JERONIMO
new core
